summary: Gaeton J. Fonzi was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Fonzi's name, along with other committee employees, their salaries, and employment dates. These documents span from April 1978 to December 1978, indicating Fonzi's period of employment with the committee.
significance: The documents indicate that Gaeton J. Fonzi was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS), which was tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. His role within the committee is not specified in these documents, but his presence on payroll and certification reports suggests he was involved in the committee's operations during the specified period.
